Operation 'ListGeoStat' has semantic quality issues: missing_input_details, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. The current description lacks clarity on input parameters (date range, aggregation options, sorting), expected output structure, and pagination details. Added specifics about authentication, parameter types, return value structure, data retention implications, and pagination support to improve AI agent interpretability.

data.current_summary: Retrieve email statistics by country and state/province.
data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to retrieve your email statistics segmented by country and state/province.**

**We only store up to 7 days of email activity in our database.** By default, 500 items will be returned per request via the Advanced Stats API endpoints.

Advanced Stats provide a more in-depth view of your email statistics and the actions taken by your recipients. You can segment these statistics by geographic location, device type, client type, browser, and mailbox provider. For more information about statistics, please see our [User Guide](https://wwww.twilio.com/docs/sendgrid/ui/analytics-and-reporting/stats-overview).
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves email statistics segmented by geographic location (country and state/province). Requires authentication via API key. Accepts optional parameters for date range filtering, metric aggregation, and sorting. Returns up to 500 geographic statistics records per request, with each record containing engagement metrics (opens, clicks, bounces, etc.) for the specified location. Data retention is limited to the previous 7 days. Supports pagination and sorting by various metrics.
data.reasoning: The current description lacks clarity on input parameters (date range, aggregation options, sorting), expected output structure, and pagination details. Added specifics about authentication, parameter types, return value structure, data retention implications, and pagination support to improve AI agent interpretability.

Similar to ListGeoStat, the description lacks specificity about input parameters, output structure, and pagination. data.current_summary: Retrieve email statistics by mailbox provider.
data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to retrieve your email statistics segmented by recipient mailbox provider.**

**We only store up to 7 days of email activity in our database.** By default, 500 items will be returned per request via the Advanced Stats API endpoints.

Advanced Stats provide a more in-depth view of your email statistics and the actions taken by your recipients. You can segment these statistics by geographic location, device type, client type, browser, and mailbox provider. For more information about statistics, please see our [Statistics Overview](https://sendgrid.com/docs/ui/analytics-and-reporting/stats-overview/).
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves email statistics segmented by mailbox provider (e.g., Gmail, Outlook, Yahoo). Requires authentication via API key. Accepts optional parameters for date range filtering, metric aggregation, and sorting. Returns up to 500 mailbox provider statistics records per request, with each record containing engagement metrics (opens, clicks, bounces, etc.) for the specified provider. Data retention is limited to the previous 7 days. Supports pagination and sorting by various metrics.
data.reasoning: Similar to ListGeoStat, the description lacks specificity about input parameters, output structure, and pagination. Enhanced description to clarify authentication requirements, parameter options, return value details, data retention constraints, and pagination capabilities for better AI agent decision-making.

message: Operation 'ListStat' has semantic quality issues: missing_input_details, missing_output_details. The current description mentions date range and account hierarchy but lacks details about specific input parameters (date format, aggregation options), output metrics, and return structure. Enhanced description to clarify parameter requirements, authentication, account-level access controls, and the types of metrics returned for improved AI agent interpretability.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to retrieve all of your global email statistics between a given date range.**

Parent accounts can see either aggregated stats for the parent account or aggregated stats for a subuser specified in the `on-behalf-of` header. Subuser accounts will see only their own stats.
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves aggregated global email statistics for a specified date range. Requires authentication via API key. Accepts parameters for start/end dates, aggregation period (day/week/month), and optional `on-behalf-of` header for parent accounts to retrieve subuser statistics. Returns global engagement metrics including sends, opens, clicks, bounces, and other delivery events. Parent accounts can view either their own aggregated statistics or a specific subuser's statistics; subuser accounts can only view their own statistics. Supports various aggregation levels for trend analysis.
data.reasoning: The current description mentions date range and account hierarchy but lacks details about specific input parameters (date format, aggregation options), output metrics, and return structure. Enhanced description to clarify parameter requirements, authentication, account-level access controls, and the types of metrics returned for improved AI agent interpretability.

Description lacks clarity on expected inputs (query parameters for date filtering, aggregation) and outputs (specific metrics returned). data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to retrieve your email statistics segmented by browser type.**

**We only store up to 7 days of email activity in our database.** By default, 500 items will be returned per request via the Advanced Stats API endpoints.

Advanced Stats provide a more in-depth view of your email statistics and the actions taken by your recipients. You can segment these statistics by geographic location, device type, client type, browser, and mailbox provider. For more information about statistics, please see our [Statistics Overview](https://sendgrid.com/docs/ui/analytics-and-reporting/stats-overview/).
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves email statistics segmented by browser type. Returns up to 500 items per request by default. Data retention is limited to 7 days of email activity. Supports filtering by date range and aggregation options. Response includes engagement metrics (opens, clicks, bounces, etc.) grouped by browser type. Use query parameters to customize date ranges, aggregation periods, and result limits.
data.reasoning: Description lacks clarity on expected inputs (query parameters for date filtering, aggregation) and outputs (specific metrics returned). Added details about parameter usage, data retention implications, and response structure to improve AI agent interpretability.

message: Operation 'ListCategoryStat' has semantic quality issues: missing_input_details, missing_output_details. Summary uses inconsistent capitalization. Description lacks details about supported query parameters, response structure, and available metrics. Added information about default grouping behavior, pagination support, and typical response contents to improve AI agent understanding of when to use this operation and what to expect.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to retrieve all of your email statistics for each of your categories.**

If you do not define any query parameters, this endpoint will return a sum for each category in groups of 10.
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve email statistics aggregated by category
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves email statistics segmented by category. Returns statistics grouped by category in groups of 10 by default. Without query parameters, returns aggregated sums for each category. Supports filtering by date range, sorting, and custom aggregation periods. Response includes engagement metrics (opens, clicks, bounces, etc.) for each category. Use limit and offset parameters for pagination.
data.reasoning: Summary uses inconsistent capitalization. Description lacks details about supported query parameters, response structure, and available metrics. Added information about default grouping behavior, pagination support, and typical response contents to improve AI agent understanding of when to use this operation and what to expect.

message: Operation 'ListCategoryStatSum' has semantic quality issues: missing_input_details, missing_output_details. Summary is adequate but description lacks clarity on required/optional parameters, specific metrics returned, and use case differentiation. Added details about date range requirements, pagination support, and guidance on when to use this endpoint versus the non-sum variant to improve AI agent decision-making.

data.current_summary: Retrieve sums of email stats for each category.
data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to retrieve the total sum of each email statistic for every category over the given date range.**

If you do not define any query parameters, this endpoint will return a sum for each category in groups of 10.
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves aggregated email statistics totals for each category over a specified date range. Returns summed metrics grouped by category in groups of 10 by default. Requires or defaults to a date range for aggregation. Response includes total engagement metrics (opens, clicks, bounces, deliveries, etc.) per category. Supports pagination via limit and offset parameters. Use this endpoint when you need category-level performance summaries rather than detailed time-series data.
data.reasoning: Summary is adequate but description lacks clarity on required/optional parameters, specific metrics returned, and use case differentiation. Added details about date range requirements, pagination support, and guidance on when to use this endpoint versus the non-sum variant to improve AI agent decision-making.

Advanced Stats provide a more in-depth view of your email statistics and the actions taken by your recipients. You can segment these statistics by geographic location, device type, client type, browser, and mailbox provider. For more information about statistics, please see our [Statistics Overview](https://sendgrid.com/docs/ui/analytics-and-reporting/stats-overview/).
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves email statistics segmented by client type (phone, tablet, webmail, desktop). Returns up to 500 items per request by default. Data retention is limited to 7 days of email activity. Supports filtering by date range and aggregation options. Response includes engagement metrics (opens, clicks, bounces, etc.) grouped by client type. Use query parameters to customize date ranges, aggregation periods, and result limits.
data.reasoning: Description lacks clarity on expected inputs (query parameters) and outputs (specific metrics). Added details about supported client types, parameter usage, data retention implications, and response structure to improve AI agent interpretability and decision-making.

message: Operation 'GetClientStat' has semantic quality issues: missing_input_details, missing_output_details. Description lacks clarity on path parameter usage and expected outputs. Added explicit mention of the client_type path parameter requirement, supported values, and response structure. Clarified that this endpoint returns data for a single client type versus the list endpoint. Improved AI agent understanding of parameter requirements and response format.

data.current_summary: Retrieve stats by a specific client type.
data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to retrieve your email statistics segmented by a specific client type.**

**We only store up to 7 days of email activity in our database.** By default, 500 items will be returned per request via the Advanced Stats API endpoints.

### Available Client Types
- phone
- tablet
- webmail
- desktop

Advanced Stats provide a more in-depth view of your email statistics and the actions taken by your recipients. You can segment these statistics by geographic location, device type, client type, browser, and mailbox provider. For more information about statistics, please see our [Statistics Overview](https://sendgrid.com/docs/ui/analytics-and-reporting/stats-overview/).
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves email statistics for a specific client type (phone, tablet, webmail, or desktop). The client_type path parameter specifies which client type to retrieve statistics for. Returns up to 500 items per request by default. Data retention is limited to 7 days of email activity. Supports filtering by date range and aggregation options. Response includes engagement metrics (opens, clicks, bounces, etc.) for the specified client type. Use query parameters to customize date ranges, aggregation periods, and result limits.
data.reasoning: Description lacks clarity on path parameter usage and expected outputs. Added explicit mention of the client_type path parameter requirement, supported values, and response structure. Clarified that this endpoint returns data for a single client type versus the list endpoint. Improved AI agent understanding of parameter requirements and response format.

Description includes helpful device type table but lacks clarity on query parameters and response structure. Simplified description to focus on key operational details while maintaining reference to available device types. Added information about parameter usage and response contents to improve AI agent interpretability.

data.current_summary: Retrieve email statistics by device type.
data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to retrieve your email statistics segmented by the device type.**

**We only store up to 7 days of email activity in our database.** By default, 500 items will be returned per request via the Advanced Stats API endpoints.

## Available Device Types
| **Device** | **Description** | **Example** |
|---|---|---|
| Desktop | Email software on desktop computer. | I.E., Outlook, Sparrow, or Apple Mail. |
| Webmail |	A web-based email client. | I.E., Yahoo, Google, AOL, or Outlook.com. |
| Phone | A smart phone. | iPhone, Android, Blackberry, etc.
| Tablet | A tablet computer. | iPad, android based tablet, etc. |
| Other | An unrecognized device. |

Advanced Stats provide a more in-depth view of your email statistics and the actions taken by your recipients. You can segment these statistics by geographic location, device type, client type, browser, and mailbox provider. For more information about statistics, please see our [Statistics Overview](https://sendgrid.com/docs/ui/analytics-and-reporting/stats-overview/).
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves email statistics segmented by device type (desktop, webmail, phone, tablet, or other). Returns up to 500 items per request by default. Data retention is limited to 7 days of email activity. Supports filtering by date range and aggregation options. Response includes engagement metrics (opens, clicks, bounces, etc.) grouped by device type. Use query parameters to customize date ranges, aggregation periods, and result limits.
